revised_title: The Role and Function of the Royal Society in Publishing Philosophical Transactions
tldr: The Royal Society clarifies its role in the publication of the Philosophical Transactions, stating that the Society does not endorse or approve the content of the articles, but rather serves as a platform for the exchange of knowledge. They emphasize that the thanks given to authors are a matter of civility and not an endorsement of their work. The Society also discourages crediting reports and public notices that claim high applause and approbation from the Society.
